pageTitle: PTPRZ1 Gene - GeneCards | PTPRZ Protein | PTPRZ Antibody
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {61632=This gene encodes a member of the receptor protein tyrosine phosphatase family. Expression of this gene is restricted to the central nervous system (CNS), and it may be involved in the regulation of specific developmental processes in the CNS. Alternatively spliced transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been described for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, May 2011], 59637=Protein tyrosine phosphatase that negatively regulates oligodendrocyte precursor proliferation in the embryonic spinal cord. Required for normal differentiation of the precursor cells into mature, fully myelinating oligodendrocytes. May play a role in protecting oligondendrocytes against apoptosis. May play a role in the establishment of contextual memory, probably via the dephosphorylation of proteins that are part of important signaling cascades (By similarity).}
textBeforeTable: Gene Ontology (GO) - Molecular Function for PTPRZ1 Gene EC 3.1.3.48 63 4 Enzyme Numbers (IUBMB) for PTPRZ1 Gene PTPRZ_HUMAN,P23471 UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot Function: Protein tyrosine phosphatase that negatively regulates oligodendrocyte precursor proliferation in the embryonic spinal cord. Required for normal differentiation of the precursor cells into mature, fully myelinating oligodendrocytes. May play a role in protecting oligondendrocytes against apoptosis. May play a role in the establishment of contextual memory, probably via the dephosphorylation of proteins that are part of important signaling cascades (By similarity). PTPRZ_HUMAN,P23471 UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot CatalyticActivity: Protein tyrosine phosphate + H(2)O = protein tyrosine + phosphate. PTPRZ1 GENATLAS Biochemistry: protein tyrosine phosphatase,receptor-type,zeta polypeptide Molecular function for PTPRZ1 Gene Function for PTPRZ1 Gene
